titleInfo.title: Letter from Francis Palms to Henrietta Lauzin and Marie Allain, 1864 Apr18

mods.note: Francis Palms (1837-1904) enlisted as a private in the Confederate Army on May 23, 1861, at Camp Moore, Louisiana He was assigned to CoF of the Delta Rifles, which was part of the 4th Louisiana Infantry Following the war, he returned to his birthplace of Detroit, Michigan, where he helped to manage his father's many interests MrPalms was married three times, and, with his second wife, Miss C.FPellerin, had seven children Henrietta Lauzin (b.1842) was the daughter of DrJean Lauzin and Leocadie Teetzman and the great-great-granddaughter of Antonio de Gras.
mods.abstract: Francis Palms, Bayou Poydras, writes to Henrietta Lauzin and Marie Allain to bid them a final goodbye before departing He thanks them for their kindness and informs them that he will write, asking them to do the same In the postscript he requests that they 'adopt an assumed name and number each letter you send' when writing.
